definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: But it seemed something wrong with the big clock. The big minute hand did not move.
sentences.chinese: 但是那钟似乎有什么不对，它的巨大的分针不动了。

sentences.english: I looked at the wall clock just in time to see its black minute hand shift to half-past.
sentences.chinese: 我看了看墙上的钟，它黑色的分针刚好跳到两点半。

sentences.english: The big minute hand did not move.
sentences.chinese: 那根巨大的分针不动了。

sentences.english: It seemed a century, minute, finally means to 12.
sentences.chinese: 似乎过了一个世纪，分针终于指到了12。

sentences.english: The longer hand is called the minute hand.
sentences.chinese: 这个长针我们称之为分针。

sentences.english: Turn back the minute hand, the time will be bake.
sentences.chinese: 把它的分针向回拨，时光于是倒流。

sentences.english: The blued minute hand in the centre dominates the clear dial.
sentences.chinese: 蓝色的分针被置于表盘的中央。

sentences.english: We noticed that the minute hand did not move.
sentences.chinese: 我们注意到分针没有动。

sentences.english: One is put to minute hand ambulates in the sitting room be born bell of sound.
sentences.chinese: 在客厅里放一座有分针走动声的落地钟等。

sentences.english: A watch's minute hand moves more quickly than did mine.
sentences.chinese: 手表的分针移动速度比没有地雷。

sentences.english: Both the hour hand and the minute hand of the clock now pointed to twelve.
sentences.chinese: 这时，钟的时针和分针都指向十二点。

definition: pointer on a gauge/clock hand/cursor/(computing) pointer
variant of 表盤|表盘[biao3 pan2]/watch face
balance (of a watch or clock)/balance wheel
